learning_outcomes.description: Apply knowledge of oral diseases to explain clinical observations and to solve clinical problems.
Demonstrate competence in the procedural skills required for the practice of minimal intervention dentistry.
Demonstrate an applied knowledge of dental material properties and their application to direct restorative techniques.
Appropriately select and use instrumentation and dental materials for the practice of minimal intervention dentistry.
Apply the principles of clinical communication, behaviour management and oral health education to the clinical setting.
Demonstrate professional conduct, including while working with other members of the dental team.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment Item 1- Restorative Practical: Class I & V
assessments.task_description: In this pre-clinical assessment, you will be allocated time within your pre-clinic time under exam conditions, to complete a specified number of Class I and V cavity preparations and/or restorations on the teeth identified to you on the day of the assessment. You must bring all PPE, restorative instruments, pre-clinic lab coat and be dressed professionally in DMD navy scrubs.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: In this pre-clinical assessment, you will be allocated time within your pre-clinic time under exam conditions, to complete a specified number of Class II cavity preparations and/or restorations on the teeth identified to you on the day of the assessment. You must bring all PPE, restorative instruments, pre-clinic lab coat and be dressed professionally in DMD navy scrubs.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.

assessments.due_date:
8/09/2025 - 26/09/2025

Will occur within weeks 7-9 peer clinic.

Student group roster will be given.
assessments.task_description: During your radiography module, you will need to demonstrate the safe competency in taking bitewings and periapical radiographs in the peer clinic setting using the Dexter manikin. This will be assessed during your rostered peer clinic sessions, where attendance is mandatory. This competency will include IO film holders orientations, as well as the bisecting angle and paralleling techniques.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Will be submitted from the Radiology clinic once allocated student session is completed.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment Item 4- Restorative Practical: Class III & IV
assessments.task_description: In this pre-clinical assessment, you will be allocated time within your pre-clinic time under exam conditions, to complete a specified number of Class III & IV cavity preparations and/or restorations on the teeth identified to you on the day of the assessment. You must bring all PPE, restorative instruments, pre-clinic lab coat and be dressed professionally in DMD navy scrubs.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: You will need to demonstrate the safe competency in the administration of LA during your peer clinic sessions. You will need to demonstrate sound infection control practices, the mantling and dismantling of a LA syringe, and the administration of an infiltration and an inferior alveolar nerve (with lingual) block using the correct anatomical knowledge and clinical procedure. You will also need to show the palatal infiltration and palatal block intraoral injection points without needing to administer the local anaesthetic for this injection.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment Item 6- Treatment Planning Case Portfolio
assessments.task_description: In this task, you are required to develop a pre-clinical case portfolio based on a fictitious patient. You will apply the appropriate phases of treatment planning as outlined by Stefanac and Nesbit (2024), demonstrate the use of evidence-based dentistry through relevant research, and provide a clear discussion with justification for the proposed treatment. Your rationale should align with the clinical findings and results of any special tests, reflecting logical clinical reasoning and sound treatment planning principles. Specifics for this assessment item will be posted on your course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment will be submitted via a link on your course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment Item 7- Clinical Case-based Viva Voce
assessments.task_description: You will review a written case (15 minutes), then participate in a 15-minute oral examination with 2-3 examiners. The discussion will assess your understanding and application of restorative dentistry principles and material science, clinical diagnoses with reasoning, simple treatment planning, and application of evidence-based practice. Bring writing materials such as a pen and highlighter and please wear professional attire or DMD navy scrubs. No electronic devices or additional resources permitted. Further details will be provided on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment Item 8- End of Semester Exam
assessments.task_description: This written examination will occur in the end of semester exam period and consists of multiple choice questions, short and long answer questions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Pre-clinic

Three (3) pre-clinic sessions per week where students will learn fundamental restorative dentistry skills.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Pre-clinic Three (3) pre-clinic sessions per week where students will learn fundamental restorative dentistry skills.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture

Two (2) lectures per week to deliver course content.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture Two (2) lectures per week to deliver course content.

learning_activities.topic:
Peer clinic

There is one (1) peer clinic session per week with peer-to-peer activities preparing you for the patient clinic.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Peer clinic There is one (1) peer clinic session per week with peer-to-peer activities preparing you for the patient clinic.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial

One (1) tutorial session per week, to practice applying the knowledge taught throughout the course via lectures and self-directed learning activities to clinical patient scenarios and patient-based learning activities.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial One (1) tutorial session per week, to practice applying the knowledge taught throughout the course via lectures and self-directed learning activities to clinical patient scenarios and patient-based learning activities.
